subject: Having trouble with junit architecture

messageBody:
I'm using junit to test a swing program.

I have written a bunch of helper functions: click this, enter this,
find that, etc. I'd like those functions to be available in every
test case. Along with that I'd like to only start the application
once and run a suite. Then close the application.

I've made a subclass of JFCTestCase which has those helper functions.
One helper function is startApplication. If I run each test
individually, there is no problem. A testcase is created, I start the
application, it runs. I close the application done.

But if I try to separete starting the application I have threading
issues. What I've tried to do is startApplication, run the suite,
then close the application. But each time my sublcass of JFCTestCase
is created, a new thread is created by JFCTestCase. This thread is
then run separately of the startApplication thread (not good). Does
this make sense?

My workaround was to create a class that passes in the reference to
an object on this thread. Which works fine.

So I now:

Create MyTestCase (which does not extend JUnit in anyway.) It has
it's own setUpo() and tearDown(). I then pass in a reference to XCase
(which extends JUnit), and run the test. But now I'm not really using
JUnit at all. It's like I'm creating my own suite object.

Any ideas/help would be greatly appreciated.
